commitResults.messageBody:
- Echo commands that are not "bye"
- Exit if "bye" command is issued

- If "list" command is issued, print list of stored items
- Otherwise, add input string to stored item list

- Mark and unmark tasks as done or not done
- Allow switching tasks between done/not done

commitResults.messageTitle: Store DukeTasks in Collection instead of array

commitResults.messageBody:
- Add ToDo, Deadline, Event tasks
- Update application styling

- Set up I/O redirection testing
- Clarified input and output constraints

- Create DukeException exception class
- Throw DukeException on incorrect inputs

- Remove tasks when "delete" command is issued
- Colorise output strings for styling

- Remove tasks when "delete" command is issued
- Colorise output strings for styling
- Check for missing descriptions

- Catch more incorrect arguments as exceptions
- Add javadocs

- Change styling
- Change access modifiers for better encapsulation

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement saving task data to hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Level-7
- Rename DukeList to TaskList for consistency
- Use file I/O operations to save task data to hard disk
- Create data/duke.txt if it doesn't exist on the user's device
- Implement a Storage class to encapsulate the above

Level-8
- Create DukeDateTimeFormatter class with a static method to encapsulate formatting in one place
- Implement DukeDateTimeFormatter in Deadline and Event classes
- Create formattedAt/formattedBy strings to represent formatted date-time strings, replace into toString

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception handling for incorrect date/time formats
Create abstractions to further implement OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
- Create Ui and Parser classes and combine them with TaskList and Storage to extract out closely related code as classes
- Refactor Duke to implement these classes
- Shift all user interactions, including I/O from the console to the Ui class
- Shift all input parsing to the Parsing class

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Command abstractions to further implement OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Create the following:
- ExitCommand
- ListItemsCommand
- MarkCommand
- UnmarkCommand
- DeleteCommand
- AddItemCommand

Create the following packages:
- duke
- duke.command
- duke.exception
- duke.parser
- duke.storage
- duke.task
- duke.tasklist
- duke.ui

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for DukeException and duke.task
commitResults.messageBody:
- Test exception getMessage method and exception type for DukeException
- Test toString and getStorageString methods in all duke.task classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDocs to public and non-trivial private methods
Make code formatting comply with se-edu's Java standard

commitResults.messageBody:
Keywords are compared with descriptions of all tasks, and hence
the keywords are required to be absolutely accurate for successful
finds.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement checkstyle and fix code style
commitResults.messageBody:
- Set indentation level to 4 spaces, and 8 spaces for wrapped lines
- Move executeAddItem and executeFindItems methods from Parser.java to AddItemCommand.java and FindCommand.java, respectively
- Add missing javadocs
- Fix javadocs formatting style
